alert.note: Alert for Dale; Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 4:27PM CDT until August 07 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Coffee, Dale, Geneva and Houston. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 426 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daleville, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Level Plains, Newton, New Brockton, Clayhatchee, Gerald, Coppinville, Keyton, Cairns Aaf, Cool Springs, Lowe Army Heliport, Knox Field, Shell Army Field, Kelly, Battens Crossroads, Power Dam Road, High Bluff and Enterprise Municipal A/P. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
